p: Forty-three compounds were identified in A. millefolium EO amounting 96.3% of the total EO ( Table 1). Oxygenated monoterpenes constituted the major part of the EO (40.7%), with camphor (12.8%), trans-chrysantenyl acetate (6.6%), terpinen-4-ol (4.70%), ( E)- p-mentha-2,8-dien-1-ol (4.5%), and 1,8-cineole (4.0%) being its main components. Other quantitatively important fractions were hydrocarbon sesquiterpenes (17%) and oxygen-containing sesquiterpenes (19.5%), germacrene-D (12.0%) and ( E)-nerolidol (7.3%) being the main components. The monoterpene part corresponded only to 15%, sabinene (6.7%) and Î²-pinene (3.4%) being its main constituents.
